source_video.description: A breakdown of the video source types in the dataset. Each label indicates whether it applies to the dataset, with supporting evidence from the paper.

Human-Generated.description: The video is entirely produced or captured by humans, e.g. live-action recordings, home videos, documentary footages.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this label applies to the dataset. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper where the human-generated nature of the video is stated or supported (e.g., 'Section 3.2').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the video is classified as human-generated.

Model-Generated.description: The video is synthetic, i.e. generated or heavily manipulated by AI models, including animations that are heavily edited or generated by AI.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this label applies to the dataset. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper where the model-generated nature of the video is stated or supported (e.g., 'Section 3.2').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the video is classified as model-generated.

Unknown Origin.description: The source of the video is not specified, not reported, or derived from web-crawl data with unclear provenance.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if the dataset includes video with unknown provenance. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper indicating the information of the video dataset (e.g., 'Appendix A').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the origin is considered unknown.

N/A.description: The dataset does not contain any video data.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if the dataset contains no video. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper confirming that the dataset does not include video (e.g., 'Section 1.1').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the dataset is not applicable for video-based analysis.
